newsitem.title: CHINA: Chinese airport readies for hijacked Taiwan plane.
newsitem.headline: Chinese airport readies for hijacked Taiwan plane.

text.p: An airport in China's southeastern city of Xiamen is preparing for the landing of a Taiwan airliner hijacked earlier on Monday, an airport official said.
"Officials are at the airport preparing for the plane's landing," the official said by telephone.

Far Eastern flight 128, a Boeing 757 with a capacity of 201 passengers, had departed from Taiwan's southern port city of Kaohsiung on a scheduled route to Taipei when it changed course and headed toward China's communist mainland.
It was not immediately known how many passengers and crew were aboard.
Aviation sources contacted by Reuters in Taiwan said a lone hijacker, said to be a journalist, doused himself with gasoline and ordered the pilot to fly to the Fujian province port of Xiamen.
